title: ASX hits another record high, tech stocks jump on Nvidia profit | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: Better-than-expected profit announcements from Australia's largest companies have driven the local share market to a new record high ‚Äî for its second consecutive day.  Shares of Qantas plunged after the airline reported a flat statutory half-year profit, while tech stocks surged after AI chipmaker Nvidia smashed expectations with its $US43 billion quarterly profit, as finance presenter David Chau explains. description: Former Australian of the Year Grace Tame has criticised Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's attempted apology after he labelled her "difficult". title: NSW teen becomes first Australian to die from tick-induced red meat allergy | ABC NEWS
description: A New South Wales teenager has become the first Australian confirmed to have died from a tick-induced reaction to red meat.  Four years ago, 16-year-old Jeremy Webb died after eating sausages while on a camping trip.  Doctors thought he died from asthma, but his parents have now proved his final meal was to blame. Courtney Barrett-Peters has this report for ABC News New South Wales. description: As the US midterm elections approach, polls suggest Americans have been dissatisfied with the state of their nation under the Trump administration. Americas Editor John Lyons has shared his first-hand accounts of life in a "divided" America, and his predictions for how Donald Trump could respond to an unfavourable midterms result. title: Children in camp for IS-linked families speak about attempt to get to Australia | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian children stuck in a Syrian refugee camp have talked about their families' failed attempt to leave.  Some of them told the ABC their brief journey outside of the camp last week was the first time they had seen the outside world.  Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the government has "compassion for the children involved" but will not repatriate the families from Syria. title: Police fire shots after man allegedly drives car at officers in Alice Springs | ABC NEWS
description: A Northern Territory Police officer has fired three shots at a ute, allegedly being driven at police in Alice Springs on Wednesday night.  A 38-year-old man has been arrested in relation to the shocking incident, he remains in custody as police continue to investigate. Mitchell Abram has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Harrowing dashcam footage shows lead up to fatal crash | ABC NEWS
description: *Warning: This video contains images that may disturb some viewers. title: Qantas to overhaul Frequent Flyer program, promises competitive airfares | ABC NEWS
description: Qantas has reported a flat first-half statutory net profit of $925 million, up $2 million on the same period last year. title: Accused front court over alleged kidnapping murder of Chris Baghsarian | ABC NEWS
description: Two men charged over the kidnapping and murder of Sydney grandfather Chris Baghsarian have faced court for the first time.  The 85-year-old was abducted from his home in North Ryde on the morning of February 13, in what police believe was a case of mistaken identity. A lawyer for one of the accused said outside court that his client is "no mastermind". title: PM explains his description of Grace Tame as 'difficult' | ABC NEWS
description: Former Australian of the Year Grace Tame has criticised Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's qualified apology after he labelled her difficult, saying "What a patronising cop out from a total coward."  He made the comment when asked to give a one-word response to a rapid-fire list of people and news topics as part of a word association game at the Future Victoria conference on Wednesday, presented by the Herald Sun newspaper and the Victorian Chamber of Commerce.  In his answers, broadcast on Sky News, the prime minister also called Pauline Hanson "divisive", Donald Trump "president", former prince Andrew a "grub", and One Nation voters "frustrated", while passing on Barnaby Joyce. title: Controversial NT administrator apologises for past social media posts | ABC NEWS
description: David Connolly is set to be sworn in at parliament house after weeks of controversy over his appointment as administrator.   After more than a month of silence, the outspoken cattleman finally issued an apology for his past social media posts about Indigenous cultural practises, women in sport and domestic violence. The ABC can report newly uncovered posts from Mr. Connolly. Jack Hislop has this report. title: "He kept making bad decisions" - Hiker convicted after partner's alpine death | The World | ABC NEWS
description: A man convicted of leaving his girlfriend to die on Austria's tallest mountain will appeal a manslaughter conviction.  A coroner's report found the 33 year-old woman died of hypothermia after her partner, an experienced mountain climber, abandoned her in the middle of a severe storm.  Mountaineering journalist Owen Clarke told The World's Yvonne Yong the hiker was given a five month suspended sentence and a fine of about AUD$16,000   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: UN warns South Sudan on brink of widescale conflict | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Renewed fighting between government and opposition forces in South Sudan's east has displaced almost 280,000 people.  The UN warns the country is on the brink of another widescale conflict, as civilians face shortages of critical supplies and a deadly cholera outbreak.  Jacob Gamble reports. title: Bali hit with torrential rain and floods | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Intense rain and flooding has engulfed parts of Bali, forcing evacuations and trapping people inside their homes. Flights have been delayed or diverted, causing significant disruptions to the island's tourism industry. Jannata 'Egi' Giwangkara from Monash University's ClimateWorks Centre joined The World's Yvonne Yong to speak about the impact of the floods on the Indonesian island.
